doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 19 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 136 [Air Date: 2/5/1985]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 19 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 136 [Air Date: 2/5/1985]

Pride and ProgressNews - highlights:1. Virginia Supreme Court child custody suitCOMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals2. Tom Stoddard, Legislative Director of New York Civil Liberties Union, on legality of gay relationships3. Federal Gay Rights Bill reintroduced in U.S. House of RepresentativesCOMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper4. Interview with Jeff Snow and Bonnie McGinley, spokepersons for Concerned Americans for Individual Rights5. The American Automobile Association in Wisconsin extends its benefits to gay couples6. Salvation Army in Wisconsin loses contract when it refuses to sign anti-discrimination clause7. Andy Humm discusses anti-gay rights activist, John J. O'Connor, Catholic Archbishop of New YorkCOMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store8. Interview with Brent Nicholson, head of The American Run for the End of AIDS9. Sports ReportCOMMERCIAL: Actor/ playwright Harvey Fierstein announces his return to "Torch Song Trilogy" at the Helen Hayes Theatre10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Elaine Noble, Addiction Recovery Corp. member, discusses alcohol and drug addiction in the gay community 11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Media reports/current eventsCOMMERCIAL: "The Gascon," a novel by John Colin Penford2. Valentine's Day edition of "Season's Eatings" with Joe AllevaCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine3. Interview with Robert Rios, director of Dallas production of "Boys in the Band"COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store3. On the Streets with Jon4. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 19 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 136 [Air Date: 2/5/1985]: February 1985
